author: Dogburt_Jr
body:
I had a few early failures while day trading, but nothing major. I first went in on GM when it was at $20 and held it to $40, and saved some to diversify my portfolio. I diversified in DAL, HPE, HPQ, WFC, and BRK.b and got a loss on all of them because I got bored of waiting.

Now I opted to split my account, have $2k in a long-term automatic portfolio and $1k I mess around with day trading. My strategy is to look for big market caps taking a sudden drop for a very reactionary reason (earnings a few % below expectation but generally considered a good company still) and buy at those prices and sell at 5-10% return.

I’m not sold on Cielo, but maybe that’s sour grapes since I was watching it before it’s recent spike and didn’t get in.

author: KirokeHarper
body:
TO EVERYONE WHO POSTED DD ON THIS PLAY--

THANK YOU.

Honestly. I'm not at a point right now where I know how to do my own DD. And reading is still really hard for my smooth brain. But I saw the DD on this yesterday, I read it all, and I realized  I was a little late to the game but I played today anyway.

It's not much but I turned a $600 investment into $1200 today. I now own 14.77 shares of RKT at avg 39.61 AND ALL OF IT IS HOUSE MONEY. This feels like a big win for me, so I just wanted to give my thanks for the DD on this play.

author: GTKFANL
body: RKT is a different situation than GME. It's not the ultra-mega-gamma-squeeze-to-end-all-squeezes. It is a good stock priced below its value and has experienced some catalyst events pushing it higher with a higher-than-usual percentage of float shorted. I wouldn't be surprised if it runs to $35 - $40 a share by Friday, but I wouldn't hold it any higher than that. Yes, there is always a chance it can explode one day and good for you if you catch it, but don't buy at $60. That's all!

author: Mackie5Million
body:
Preface: this is not financial advice.

The past hour or so has been dominated by aggressive shorting of the stock.  [Borrowdesk](https://iborrowdesk.com/report/RKT) is tracking the available short shares, which are quickly diminishing.  Once there are none left, short sellers won't be able to force the market down anymore.

Diamond hands, people.  This has happened before - it can happen again.

author: findspeopleforfun
body: Why did GME's price **quadruple in the span of a day** last week AFTER the biggest players in the game attempted for weeks to snuff it out? To not only resist dropping back to early January numbers after being illegally manipulated by the most powerful investors in the world, but rather **QUADRUPLE** in the face of this adversity is the most blatant sign that it's still a great investment to literally anyone who's not an absolute dog brained retard. Even a child with Downs syndrome could look at the absurdly lopsided ask prices for GME calls vs puts, which as of right now show that **$500 calls are worth the same amount as $66 puts,** and see with absolute clarity how bullish the market is for this stock. Even boomer analysts and extremely popular trading platforms are bullish on GME. Anyone still shilling silver and weed, get Melvin's dick out of your mouth and get in on this historically massive bull run you apes.

author: baconara
body:
Found people wondering why RKT had 3x the volume of GME but it wasn't "squeezing right".

For RKT folks browsing this megathread: it won't squeeze the same because RKT is an artificial squeeze - engineered by the CEO. It's not an organic squeeze. GME was years in building. 

RKT looks like a fish, swims like a fish, but when you go to eat it you realize it's a robot fish. Same amount of fun fishing, though.

author: Saxamaphooone
body:
I want to thank everyone in these threads for helping me get through my days. I only have 7 shares @169, but I’m hoping any profits help pay some medical bills. 

I found out a month ago why I’ve been so sick over the past year: I have a tumor in my brain growing on my pituitary gland. The type of tumor it is means it’s likely non-cancerous (thankfully), but it secretes hormones which causes hormone imbalances, migraines, and weird vision issues. I spend weeks at a time trapped in my bed, unable to move or eat solid food without throwing up. Reading this sub and these threads makes those days a little easier!

author: pastrybaker
body:
Is anyone else pretty impressed that it's holding at these levels even though it's off the SSR today? 

According to [https://iborrowdesk.com/report/GME](https://iborrowdesk.com/report/GME), there was some big shorting going on this morning through Interactive Brokers. So, we could assume the same was happening with other brokers. At the same time, I know that at least TDA isn't allowing short selling of GME at all (was on the phone with them the other day, and the guy told me they haven't allowed it since the end of January).

Still, the price has not only held, but risen pretty significantly today. I'm having a hard time seeing the downside to continuing to hold, I just don't think it's a wise thing to sell at this point. The gamma squeeze seems like it'll happen, the short squeeze is likely too. And even if it's not, the company is pivoting and may become a big player in the years to come. All those things are why I will keep holding.

At the same time, if you haven't covered your initial investment, please do so. I sold off enough at the end of January to pay off almost $50k of CC debt and to have a bit leftover to provide for me and my kids. Now I'm playing with house money, so it's easier for me to weather the dips.

I'm holding 307 shares @ \~$70 per share. I also have a 17 calls for different dates.

author: willy-fistergash08
body:
Things we should keep in mind today:


•	⁠There is no way to predict when the squeeze will happen
	⁠•	⁠There will be crazy price action in both directions
	⁠•	⁠This can go on as long as the shorts remain solvent
	⁠•	⁠The longer they drag this out, the higher it goes
	⁠•	⁠People might say, "Lift-Off in 10!" But they're just excited
	⁠•	⁠Nobody knows when it'll happen or how high it will go

Basically, don't believe the hype, but feel free to join in. You should do your own research, read the DD, and make informed decisions. Don't invest money you can't afford to lose.

In other words, fuck safely, or you'll get fucked.

•	⁠There is no "we."
	⁠•	⁠I'm holding because that's my choice. I believe in GME
	⁠•	⁠I will not buy because someone else says to do so
	⁠•	⁠I will not encourage others to buy
	⁠•	⁠Nothing I say is financial advice
	⁠•	⁠If you're confused, read the rules. No market manipulation.

Report posts that encourage everyone to buy at the same time. The primary reason for this is legal, but the secondary is that the media will cherry-pick comments like this to give us a bad name and put more negativity out there through their articles, broadcasts, etc.

•	⁠There will be plenty of FUD (or "fear, uncertainty, and doubt")
	⁠•	⁠I am including this out of belief, if not pure spite
	⁠•	⁠There are redditors being paid to scare you
	⁠•	⁠There are bots made to SPAM negativity
	⁠•	⁠There are people profiting when you sell
	⁠•	⁠This starts ramping up in the afternoon

There are two sides to this fight, and we have to remember that there are people profiting if we fail. There are people playing the other side who will come into the thread and try to throw us off track by ruining the morale. We mustn't give in to them. Besides, they can't even provide any good DD for their bear-case, it's all just "sElL iT's OvEr."

•	⁠This is the motherfucking GME Megathread
	⁠•	⁠Do not push other tickers
	⁠•	⁠Do not jingle keys in our faces
	⁠•	⁠Fuck you

I, personally, go out of my way to CTRL/CMD+F and search for other tickers. If you're bringing up non-GME stocks in order to distract the thread, I'm one of the downvotes on your comment. Sue me.

•	⁠We can fucking do this
	⁠•	⁠We have them where we want them
	⁠•	⁠We can name our price
	⁠•	⁠As long as we hold, we have what they want
	⁠•	⁠They will pay out the ass to get it

They'll do whatever they can (manipulate the market, short the stock further, short EFTs, etc.) for as long as they can manage, all hoping we'll give up and sell (Hell, they've even tried to bore us to death). But they don't understand just how dumb we really are. We are far too stupid to be afraid of their fearmongering, and we'll hold 'til the moon.

•	⁠If you're new, this may not be for you
	⁠•	⁠This is something you have to be really brave or really stupid for
	⁠•	⁠You will either see enormous gains or enormous losses
	⁠•	⁠Invest wisely, don't spend your rent money, and read the DD
	⁠•	⁠Read the DD
	⁠•	⁠Read the DD
	⁠•	⁠DD is short for Due Diligence, and it's basically just researching a stock before you buy in. There's plenty of great DD on this sub, and you can sort by the DD flair to see the highest-voted posts. Do that before asking dumb questions and risking your karma.

If you think there's anything else I should add, please reply and tell me.

author: SirioBombas
body:
If you haven’t already. Read this... A few lines about GME (please read)

1. Price doesn't matter until the squeeze has been squoze.
2. The best time to buy GME was 2 months ago, the second best time is NOW.
3. Buy shares, not options. Invest only the money you can afford to lose.
4. Don't fall for FUD. Any account can be a shill/bot, even the ones created before January. They are PAYING users to spread fear and enroll you to post negative comments/posts.
5. GME has been and will always be the only play. Anything else is a distraction to limit the impact GME can have. (Yes, even RKT). Never will the planets align this perfectly again to trigger the biggest short squeeze of your lifetime.
6. The most important point : Don't sell. Supply and demand : you have something they want, we all do. So YOU set the price you want. And the price can actually go up to infinity. This is going to be the biggest transfer of wealth the world has ever seen, don't ruin it being a paper hand and selling low.
7. Hold. Hold. Hold. Selling at 1k is trolling. They want you to sell at 1k, that's why they keep spamming comments saying they put stop limits at 1k. 1k is lowball. 1k could just be a gamma squeeze. 10k is lowball.
8. As stated by u/Polihanna, the squeeze will last multiple days. Don't be afraid that it lasts a few seconds and you'll miss it. You won't. 
9. Don't day-trade GME. It's extremely volatile, and you actually help them by selling shares that they can buy for cheap. You delay the squeeze and reduce its impact if you day-trade.
10. THIS IS NOT A GAME OF GREED. IT IS A GAME OF TRUST.

HOLD STRONG LADS.
